intro: Cynoglossum lateriflorum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and western Asia. It features distinctive, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and wildflower landscapes.
